Message: Great, there's lots of benefits by not gambling.  Some benefits are getting out of debt, improving relationships, feeling healthier and less stressed, feeling better about yourself.  What do you see as your benefits by stopping gambling?
Alright, that's fine! See you later.
Great, so to achieve that, do you want to stop all gambling?
Great, here are some quick tips to start this journey:  Avoid tempting environments; Limit access to finances; Find healthier activities to do
Do you want to cut back?
Try to limit how many days you go gambling, or set a maximum amount you can spend.  Take some time now to write down what you want to achieve
Alright, that's fine! See you later.
I'll hold you to that goal!
You are not alone. Do you want to talk to someone?
Do you think you can win back what you have lost by gambling more?
You can phone a friend, call the Gambling Helpline 0800 654 655 or text 8006 for more information
If you want more information, you can go to choicenotchance.org.nz
Do you gamble using money meant for other things?
Do you lie about your gambling to people you care about?
Do you get angry or defensive when people ask about your gambling?
Do you borrow money just so you can gamble?
Did you answer yes to most of these?
It looks like gambling is hurting you and maybe those you care about. Do you want to talk to someone about it?
Okay that's great! If you want more information, you can go to choicenotchance.org.nz
Do you prefer indoors or outdoors activities?
That's fine! You can always come back for more ideas if you need
Why don't you invite your friends over for dinner? You find some recipes at myfamily.kiwi/foods
You can go for a walk, visit a museum or gallery with your friends or family. Going to a nearby park is also a fun thing to do!
